meanings.definition: To furnish or supply with something
meanings.sent1: She was plenishing the shelves with new books.
meanings.sent2: The store owner was plenishing the display with fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The magician plenished the empty hat with a rabbit, to the surprise of the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter plenished the room with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The rain plenished the dry fields, bringing life back to the crops.

meanings.definition: To stock or supply with goods
meanings.sent1: The warehouse workers were plenishing the shelves with new products.
meanings.sent2: The supermarket is plenishing its inventory for the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The pirates plenished their ship with treasures from the island.
meanings.sent4: Her smile plenished his heart with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The bees plenished the hive with nectar collected from flowers.

meanings.definition: To fill or replenish with items or provisions
meanings.sent1: She was plenishing the picnic basket with sandwiches and drinks.
meanings.sent2: The hotel room service is plenishing the mini-bar with snacks and beverages.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel plenished its stash with nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His words plenished her soul with comfort and reassurance.
meanings.sent5: The stream plenished the lake with fresh water, sustaining the ecosystem.
